channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Russian President Vladimir Putin is set to travel to the Middle East this week, a rare trip abroad intended to signal that the war in Ukraine hasn't diminished Moscow's place on the world stage https://t.co/731PqBe7fj

President Biden is returning to Washington without a pledge from the Saudis to further increase oil production. U.S. officials said his summit with the Saudi crown prince will eventually yield more tangible progress, but that it likely will take time. https://t.co/pnMTMxfl1l

Sri Lankan Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe will oversee the election of an interim president following President Gotabaya Rajapaksa’s resignation, the country’s parliamentary speaker said https://t.co/4OByPNxLRI

More than half the U.S. population lives in counties where Covid-19 cases and hospitalizations are high enough that people should wear masks in indoor public settings, according to Centers for Disease Control and Prevention data https://t.co/IKEZKnOwux
The euro is hurtling toward parity with the dollar for the first time since its early years of existence https://t.co/2lP09o0BNW

Starbucks is closing 16 of its locations in the U.S. by the end of the month after workers reported safety concerns, drug use and other issues. Here’s the full list of the stores closing. https://t.co/b2aRU5WyY6

More than half the U.S. population lives in counties where Covid-19 cases and hospitalizations are high enough that people should wear masks in indoor public settings, according to Centers for Disease Control and Prevention data https://t.co/Dr1BCG1USq
After a tight finish, American Fred Kerley is the new fastest man in the world https://t.co/YY75hvWuBA
A Ukrainian family fleeing the war took a harrowing journey through Russian-occupied territory and Russia itself to reach safety https://t.co/NTSdQzGhNw
Three years ago, Anna Weyant’s drawings were selling for $400 on the beach. Now the 27-year-old is an art star whose paintings sold for nearly $4 million combined at auction. https://t.co/Ml4uBlTI1m
The number of U.S. residents in Portugal leaped last year. Here's why so many Americans are relocating there. https://t.co/7CwT2VI7sZ

From @WSJopinion: Russia has at least 10 times as many artillery and missile systems as Ukraine. The West has been too slow, and the need to even out the artillery disparity is urgent, writes @JillianKayM. https://t.co/NfoocAPbOQ

A self-portrait of Vincent van Gogh was discovered on the back of one of the famed Dutch artist’s paintings, hidden under layers of glue and cardboard, the National Galleries of Scotland said https://t.co/ioLDtjsl9l

“It’s murderous.” Iran and Russia are engaged in a fierce competition for sales of oil, refined crude products and metals, even as they align against the West on sanctions and Ukraine. https://t.co/Zf7zs62j1t

From @WSJopinion: The moral and political confusion of the contemporary West is the secret weapon that the leaders of Russia and China believe will bring the American world order to its knees, writes @wrmead https://t.co/2uXoFgMEyR
Russian oligarchs including Roman Abramovich are seeking to reverse EU sanctions against them, alleging in court that their rights have been infringed https://t.co/h2zHaaZS6V
Our reporter drove from New Orleans to Chicago and back to test the feasibility of taking a road trip in an EV. She wouldn’t do it again soon. https://t.co/teMwP555qf
Inflation-protected U.S. savings bonds are yielding an eye-popping 9.62%—if you can fight through the red tape to actually buy one https://t.co/a4cpMORdGH
Migration to the Sunbelt has helped make parts of the South and West generally less segregated than large metros in the Northeast and Midwest https://t.co/M4vou1EGt3
Essay: Russia and China are building deeper ties to the southern hemisphere in a bid to eclipse the influence of the West, writes @GeraldFSeib https://t.co/FrkCOtkIqM
The Ukraine war is proving a high-profile testing ground for Elon Musk’s Starlink, which has drawn praise from the country’s military leaders https://t.co/04UBhOr3kr
Elon Musk filed a motion opposing Twitter’s request to expedite a trial over his attempt to end his $44 billion takeover https://t.co/NE91yzbrfS
Take a look at the front page of today's Wall Street Journal https://t.co/CanXYu0Euc https://t.co/F3QISvKEH4
"Microsoft just moved from supporting character in advertising to a main character." The tech company's deal with Netflix reignites its online-ad ambitions. https://t.co/369XBMc15e

Twitter and Elon Musk have each picked lawyers from powerhouse firms for their battle against one another, a fight prompted by Mr. Musk’s attempt to walk away from a $44 billion deal. Here's what we know about each side's representation. https://t.co/zmwWQauU4x
Wordle, the viral internet word game, is becoming a board game for sale later this year https://t.co/VpcpCqZnA9
Jayland Walker, the unarmed Black motorist who was shot and killed by police in Akron, Ohio, had 46 gunshot wounds on his body, according to a summary of his autopsy https://t.co/xiSxJs6PRZ
In the 1810s, Boston entrepreneur Frederic Tudor started selling ice for people to use in beverages. Soon iced drinks were known around the world as an American signature. https://t.co/cdktGepQs9
Here is an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal's weekend edition https://t.co/HDy63tXjoM https://t.co/4ROBJyJHtK

An elite unit of Mexico’s navy captured drug lord Rafael Caro Quintero, who had been released by a Mexican judge in 2013 after serving 28 years in prison for the killing of a DEA agent https://t.co/BmQwcqDnaL

From @WSJopinion: The President wouldn’t have to seek Saudi oil if he unleashed America’s. The U.S. needs a better relationship with the Saudis for regional security as much as for oil. https://t.co/AILZYWaYWf
Jayland Walker, the unarmed Black motorist who was shot and killed by police in Akron, Ohio, had 46 gunshot wounds on his body, according to a summary of his autopsy https://t.co/jQTy5DlTBu
Former Supreme Court Justice Stephen Breyer is returning to Harvard Law School, his alma mater https://t.co/Ms2z7hPhP5

Starbucks is closing 16 of its locations in the U.S. by the end of the month after workers reported safety concerns, drug use and other issues. Here’s the full list of the stores closing. https://t.co/6FwtzUDgVB
The House passed a bill protecting abortion access after the Supreme Court ended the federal right to the procedure, but it's unlikely to advance in the Senate https://t.co/Z8GYLrtPXi
President Biden is meeting with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, hoping to end a feud with an oil-rich monarchy that could help tame inflation https://t.co/sPfPaVN1nE

A nearly 13-acre waterfront compound that includes a six-bedroom main house, a guesthouse, a roughly 40-foot-long heated pool, and tennis court in the Hamptons is coming on the market for $65 million https://t.co/d6fjh9xzsp

Missiles struck the southern Ukrainian city of Mykolaiv, hitting two universities, according to regional officials, the latest in a series of Russian airstrikes on civilian areas https://t.co/F0qXWGwRNc
As U.S. rocket launchers help Ukraine strike Russian bases, allies are asking whether it is enough to avert a protracted war https://t.co/pMRzCLscvh
Traders are betting on bigger losses for stocks after a punishing stretch that has pushed the S&P 500 toward its worst start to a year in nearly a century https://t.co/n1VhvR0qOP

Twitter and Elon Musk have each picked lawyers from powerhouse firms for their battle against one another, a fight prompted by Mr. Musk’s attempt to walk away from a $44 billion deal. Here's what we know about each side's representation. https://t.co/ynQ5pJ37MO
Wordle, the viral internet word game, is becoming a board game for sale later this year https://t.co/T97YGRgJIs
Ericsson said the U.S. had authorized its $6.2 billion proposal to buy Vonage, clearing the way for the deal to be completed next week https://t.co/FiO3uGRlAr
Amazon has started slashing the number of its private-label products and has discussed exiting that business to ease regulatory pressure, people familiar say https://t.co/U8Dh2nc8eP

Brittney Griner had a prescription to use marijuana for medical purposes from a doctor in Arizona, leading her to have vape cartridges with hashish oil in her belongings when she flew to Russia in mid-February, her defense lawyers said. https://t.co/D0tUIy3g9f
Shoppers boosted retail spending in June by 1% as inflation reached a new four-decade high https://t.co/m56CGyOoZO

Sri Lanka’s president resigned after days of protest over the country’s economic meltdown, triggered by the pandemic, inflation and growing debts #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/F90VlYzibc https://t.co/POV83lp0Du
Rising Chinese exports to Russia of microchips and other items—some with military applications—are undermining the West's push to stall Moscow's war effort https://t.co/c3GOt9gfiV
BlackRock, the world’s largest asset-management firm, said its quarterly profit fell 22% amid a bruising market downturn https://t.co/vEJ4oeTQXO
Bill Gates said he thinks cryptocurrencies and NFTs are “100%” based on the greater fool theory https://t.co/KkJvEMuq9W
